com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.util

Interface TreeNode

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractTreeNode, DevToolkit.UITreeNode, ObjectGraphNode, TableTreeNode

    public interface TreeNode
    Represents a node in a tree structure. The API is loosely based on Swing's DefaultMutableTreeNode.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Yiannis Paschalidis

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(TreeNode node)
      Adds the given TreeNode to this node.
      Iterator<TreeNode> breadthFirst() 
      Iterator<TreeNode> children() 
      Iterator<TreeNode> depthFirst() 
      TreeNode getChildAt(int index)
      Retrieves the TreeNode at the given index.
      int getChildCount() 
      int getIndex(TreeNode aChild)
      Return the index of the child node.
      int getLevel() 
      TreeNode getParent() 
      TreeNode[] getPath()
      Returns the path from the root, to get to this node.
      TreeNode getRoot() 
      boolean isAncestor(TreeNode otherNode)
      Indicates whether the given node is an ancestor of this node.
      boolean isDescendant(TreeNode otherNode)
      Indicates whether the given node is a descendant of this node.
      boolean isLeaf()
      True if and only if this node has no child nodes.
      boolean isRelated(TreeNode otherNode)
      Returns true if and only if otherNode is in the same tree as this node.
      void remove(TreeNode child)
      Removes the given tree node from this node.
      void removeAll()
      Removes all children from this node.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        void add(TreeNode node)
        Adds the given TreeNode to this node.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to add.

      • children

        Iterator<TreeNode> children()
        Returns:
        an iteration of this TreeNode's children.

      • depthFirst

        Iterator<TreeNode> depthFirst()
        Returns:
        a depth-first iteration of this TreeNode's children.

      • breadthFirst

        Iterator<TreeNode> breadthFirst()
        Returns:
        a breadth-first iteration of this TreeNode's children.

      • getChildAt

        TreeNode getChildAt(int index)
        Retrieves the TreeNode at the given index.
        Parameters:
        index - the child index.
        Returns:
        the child TreeNode at the given index.

      • getIndex

        int getIndex(TreeNode aChild)
        Return the index of the child node. Return -1 if the node is not a child of this node.
        Parameters:
        aChild - the node to return index of.
        Returns:
        the index of the child or -1 if there is no such child node.

      • getChildCount

        int getChildCount()
        Returns:
        the number of child TreeNodes that this node contains.

      • getParent

        TreeNode getParent()
        Returns:
        the parent TreeNode, or null if the root of the tree.

      • remove

        void remove(TreeNode child)
        Removes the given tree node from this node.
        Parameters:
        child - the TreeNode to remove.

      • removeAll

        void removeAll()
        Removes all children from this node.

      • isDescendant

        boolean isDescendant(TreeNode otherNode)
        Indicates whether the given node is a descendant of this node.
        Parameters:
        otherNode - the node to check
        Returns:
        true if the given node is a descendant of this node.

      • isAncestor

        boolean isAncestor(TreeNode otherNode)
        Indicates whether the given node is an ancestor of this node.
        Parameters:
        otherNode - the node to check
        Returns:
        true if the given node is a descendant of this node.

      • getLevel

        int getLevel()
        Returns:
        the node's level, ie. the number of parent nodes until the root.

      • isLeaf

        boolean isLeaf()
        True if and only if this node has no child nodes.
        Returns:
        true if the node has no child nodes.

      • isRelated

        boolean isRelated(TreeNode otherNode)
        Returns true if and only if otherNode is in the same tree as this node. Returns false if otherNode is null.
        Parameters:
        otherNode - the node to check.
        Returns:
        true if otherNode is in the same tree as this node; false if otherNode is null

      • getRoot

        TreeNode getRoot()
        Returns:
        the root node.

      • getPath

        TreeNode[] getPath()
        Returns the path from the root, to get to this node. The last element in the path is this node.
        Returns:
        an array of DefaultTreeNode objects giving the path, where the first element in the path is the root and the last element is this node.
